oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cabinet card of Daniel Chambers Miller
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sgt. Daniel Chambers Miller, Co. K, 19th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA from Hawkins County, Tenn. enlisted May 22, 1861. He was on detached duty with the provost office in Rogersville, Tennessee beginning in October 1862. He left Hawkins County after the war due to being a Confederate and moved to Seven Mile, VA and then to Marion, VA where he operated a school. He was born August 20, 1837 in Hawkins County, Tenn. and died Feb. 12, 1899.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Miller, Daniel Chambers
